description: Vampire numbers (definition 1): n has a nontrivial factorization using n's digits.
comments: Nontrivial means that there must be at least two factors.
references: Clifford A. Pickover, A Passion for Mathematics, Wiley, 2005; see p. 65.
links: Gordon Hamilton, Three integer sequences from recreational mathematics, Video (2013?).
crossrefs: The following sequences are all closely related: A020342, A014575, A080718, A048936, A144563.
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jan 03 2009
